UzlvJWpeKHr2yXQpdxRX2g.text: Prices aren't too bad. Too cluttered and obnoxious for me. Jumbo chili cheese dog was pretty good taste, barely bigger than a regular hot dog. Was on a sesame bun. Ordered a chocolate cake shake, way too sweet it burnt the back of your throat and didn't even taste like ice cream, nor did the regular chocolate shake. Just taste like sugar. Gross. I returned it for a regular fountain drink. Wouldn't recommend it

sxgcyvPxRV-Syj3jRDmDbA.text: Best and probably the only Italian beef in town. I'm from Chicago and most people around here look at me funny when I mention Italian beef. This is a little drive from my house but well worth the trip. Chocolate cake is also pretty awesome. It gets busy at times but after tasting you can see why.

-ZEGFBALxg5aNsc6x4h4bQ.text: Again trying to get a good Italian Beef sandwich. Portillos comes with Chicago creds. Unfortunately their Italian Beef lacked the tasty juice with limited peppers asked for. Though better prices than Luke's restaurant, it was a clear 2nd place when it came to quality of beef, flavor, peppers and wet. Also disappointed that hot dogs were boiled, instead of grilled. Thanks for reading. The Bike Chaplain

XGaiLgnzmCGNb1jXceeDZw.text: Chicago! ! I never had hotdogs that tasted bland and overpriced,.i believe they buy cheap hotdogs at food city, overprice them, call.it Chicago hot dogs and sell it to the fools who will pay the price! Nothing special!! Buy your dogs at costco and save your money!

BChguzRiB4AyFk4zoM-2-g.text: Love the burgers very good food. Drive thru fast. Love portillos. Great service. I would recommend

v31ACqrU5_EnQ_O__QQwlg.text: Really good concept. You know what you are getting. Greasy, tasty, fast and decent price. Like the layout and ambiance.  This is not high end gourmet food but for tasty and filling beef, dipped sandwiches, its hard to beat.

1mRze6n9eWc7vaLbEhZIxA.text: I found this place by googling Italian Beef while I was in town for a visit.  Even though I was only here a week, I came here 2 times to indulge in this delicious sandwich!  Since I got it to go, I got the dip sauce on the side.  I can't wait to visit town again cuz this time I'll eat in and get it fully dipped right there.  The onion rings and fries are delicious.  The crew, in both visits, were extremely friendly and efficient!   Very happy with my experience here!

HTFbmZ6qvcikTwefxvGGlQ.text: Order the Italian beef sandwich with sweet and hot peppers and extra gravy. If you are still hungry go get a chicago dog and a shake. This isn't fine dining.

DfnE2ogQOF-gDyUAitO5dA.text: I've only been here once so far, but I really liked the dog I got... I don't remember which one it was, but it was good!

R1KHFaxDdZqpBeCpYqEhAg.text: Why is there an option for delivery time if you are not actually delivering it then? I appreciate the promptness but I choose a specific time because that is when my lunch break starts. I can't come down and get my food from the delivery driver too early without getting in trouble. No issues with the food itself but PLEASE pay attention to delivery time and do t bring it too early or too late. This happened the last time I ordered delivery, too, and the previous delivery person was not as patient as this one.

PgAcFf8-n2kUs8lX6r2FSw.text: You come here for the beef and that is all.  Have it dipped and served with peppers.  Do not consider anything else on the menu.  I reluctantly tried a hot dog today, full well knowing I would regret the decision later, but just had to try something else out of curiosity.    The hot dog was good.  My friend said his tamale was good.  We both lost to our other friend who had the dipped beef with peppers.  It's a damn good sandwich, and you'll be happy you got it.

Ykzxu5jcTKixSEm2ttgXpQ.text: I enjoy the food here and it's generally always good. The last two times I've been in my food has been cold. This last visit I ordered a regular cheese burger and fries. The fries were fresh and hot as always and the meat was cooked but cold to the point where the cheese wouldn't even melt. I took it back up to the counter but got the same thing back. Every place can be hit or miss but lately this location had been slacking.

Akrkj_K9wDF-pWnHZK98Tw.text: Today was my first time there. Their food was excellent. The environment was pleasant and bustling. The wait staff and Personnel were very pleasant and helpful. I would go back in a heartbeat. Love the sausage and Italian beef sandwich. One of my all-time favorite sandwiches. And if you haven't been here yet you should really try this place out.

4fv3tByLqyPz6sOlQXxmwg.text: Being a Chicago native. Nothing can beat Chicago food. This and Al's beef in North Scottsdale will give you best Italian beef sandwiches in AZ. This is a must visit for good chitown food

5BUjf9dklF4cLEdt5VHsBw.text: Anxiously awaited the big opening and finally went. Not impressed. While sitting and picking through the food that we got, we overheard a female manager picking apart and employee! Right on the dining room floor at a few tables away from us. She wrote him up, suspended him and we overheard her disappointment in him.  Poor form lady. Wouldn't an office or even the outside patio be more appropriate?  It was embarrassing for the employee, her and the restaurant.

k7o1gStCvVyST0fDKAUG5w.text: Love Love Love! I love hot dogs, so ideally I like their hotdog with all the trimmings! B likes the hotdog and the Italian beef. We've also had the chicken sandwich which is pretty good. For fast food and a taste for Chicago in AZ, this place is great.

7Yana99ir6e5Urym90HNEg.text: Went here with a group of 9 before an ASU vball game. It's a good place to grab a bite for such occasions. They have plenty of seating, enough selection for families and relatively fast service even when super busy on a Saturday night. The food is ok, but take this as a fast food joint, not 5 star food. Italian beef, cake shake and fries are top of the list, but they offer salads, smoothies and chicken sandwiches that are decent. I lived in Chicago, so for me it's about nostalgia, but I'm staying in the 3's none the less.

dZMPCMzNfPlS15GwDTod_Q.text: This place is too hectic, too unorganized, and worst of all, customer service is awful. I think it's inherent in their setup and restaurant design to be a failure. Yelling at customers to "move out of the hallway", the careless attitude amongst every employee, and the general crazy atmosphere. Normally I'd dismiss that kind of stuff if the quality of the food was amazing, but the food is just meh. Certainly doesn't live up to the hype I always hear about it. Customer service can make or break an experience, and it mostly just shattered this one.

mNIyJxtygrpYGko_ASvFUg.text: This was our first time here and I must say that I am a fan! fast, friendly service and GREAT food make this place a great spot to eat a wiener or a fantastic Italian beef sandwich.

4jG8yzRpbzptodYY6uXi-A.text: This was my first time to eat at portillos. I got the beef sandwich with hot peppers and cheese fries as a side. The staff there is really nice and help direct you ever step of the ordering process. The food came out quickly and was correct.   The first thing I noticed when opening up my sandwich is how greasy it was! That usually doesn't bother me but dang this sandwich was drenched! The paper it was wrapped in was even drenched. The sandwich tasted good and the peppers added some flavor. I won't be rushing back and don't understand what the hype was about, but in the future if I do return I'll try out another item from the menu.

3kGMsNH6grqmz5sbHELJqQ.text: I was so so so excited to try this place.  I was even more excited after it opened and I drove over.  The ambiance is adorable and they have outdoor eating.  Ordered a hot dog, cheese fries and a chocolate cake shake.  The hot dog was fine, I think Costco sells a way better one.  The fries were just okay also, Del Taco blows them away.... the cheese is served in a little cup on the side and that wasn't to great either.  The chocolate cake shake was actually kinda icky.  There was so much cake it was dry and you couldn't drink it through the straw provided.  I actually took it back and asked to try the strawberry instead.  Also not impressed.  I WILL NOT be back.

W33-Zhe4RAPTE-0iuOJ8Yw.text: Havent had everything on their menu which is very extensive.  First item up.  Chicago dog which I rate very highly.  The Italian Beef...ehh...not so much.  Thought it lacked depth of flavor.  The cheese fries are unstoppable...although I dislike the fact that they serve the cheese up in a plastic cup on the side.  I've also had the Halibut Filet sandwich.  Good not great.  The decor in this place is something to see.  Heard so many good things about this place...been twice...and I am still on the fence on if I would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salad with fruit, gorgonzola and walnuts. Oh!  And cheese fries of course!
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Italian beef with sweet peppers.  On a scale of 1 to 10.  I give it a 6. It was not amazing.

bgiPaX1JbMpTpERog4wmQg.text: Really good Italian beef. Definitely a must with the cheese fries. Delicious!!! Not a big fan of the chocolate cake shake, a little too sweet for me.

2URD2-8xCN385Xm-Eld8ow.text: Great Italian Beef.  NOT as good as Al's Beef, but still great nonetheless. I like this Tempe location; great vibe and spacious. Great music too. Next time I'll try the Chicago Dog and chocolate cake shake.

h07M5yuVT0iG8ISBDV4Vyg.text: This was average at best. I frequented the Chicagoland locations years ago and always had an amazing experience. This one, not so much. The Portillos Dog was not impressive. A small dog with a cheap bun and a failed attempt with the weak fixings. That's just mine. My wife's Apple Walnut Chicken salad was bland, no taste whatsoever and overpriced. That is all to say about that. My son said his burger was good, but his chocolate shake was not. I tried it and it did taste like it was made with generic Hershey's syrup. Not planning a return visit anytime soon. If your visit was a better experience, congratulations.

64RaIv0n07ioqbso2_UttQ.text: Looove a good Chicago dog so decided to try it out. Just as others have said, the food here is fine, good, average. The jumbo dog was good, but nothing special. I can truthfully get a better hot dog right down the street or at any Costco.  I also got the Italian beef. That was better, but again, nothing to write home about. chocolate malt was good. I ordered the large which is enough for 3 people.   I will probably go back, but don't see it being a regular stop. Worth a try to figure out yourself.

fNps6hmtl3hZ2Mrz8jY0Bw.text: I'm a total fan of the Italian Beef Sandwich and their crinkle cut fries.......I wish they'd open one in Old Town Pasadena...

yDn8SzYwqi13Hxyt33taAw.text: This place was just...okay.  Not terrible but nothing spectacular either. The decore and atmosphere was really great! You can tell they put alot of money and work into the place. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The food, however, was kind of blah. We did get our meals to go and ate it back in the office, so maybe it was because it wasn't piping hot that it didn't taste so good...? But I doubt it. My two other co-workers messaged me that they also didn't care for it. My onion rings were over cooked and were mostly breading, and my char-grilled chicken sandwich was breaded which I wasn't expecting. All in all this place was decent enough but I'd rather go elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Order pick up.

xyEpR_sgBwyuzMNZP6jTrg.text: Best Italian beef ever!!! Order dipped with hot and sweet peppers to die for!!!!!  Chicago Classic in Arizona!!!

FgTMz5Nm6jtiFPykFesQBQ.text: Hooray! I don't have to go all the way to Chicago to get Portillo's anymore!   Fantastic Italian Beef sandwiches, and onion rings for which it's worth driving all the way to Arizona. Go get some!

MAnM1J5D6YzNrRdfzLBCJg.text: Super yummy and reasonably priced. My husband got a chili cheese dog and some fries - the fries are small, but really cheap, so we can't complain! I got a Maxwell St Polish and side salad. The polish was really good, and the salad was generously sized. Their pickles are AMAZING. I'm a pickle lover, and these were the best dill pickles I've ever had. They'll give you extra if you ask! We'll be back for sure.

nc7UAI2YYpR6NiNOtjbLYA.text: Food was good, service was a little slow, but they try.  Decent selection and quality hot dogs.

jzFke7e6BUx4GdlzbGAibg.text: I'm from Chicago and loved portillos! Can't believe I found one here in Phoenix! Absolutely delicious!

btrI6jMXWhUKGmJHZJhlrw.text: The food was okay. A bit pricey for sandwiches, fries and drinks. Plus, they kind of rushed us through our order. Not happy about that. Okay for a chain restaurant.

ky6p047c31fbpfQ_cXZ6dg.text: Why do you serve fries cold and soggy? I don't get it. And when I ask for fresh hot French fries I get attitude from your staff. This would never be allowed in Chicago. These corporate spin offs just don't care.

oZMNy0vbd5BztFZGAhb2aQ.text: First, let me say this review is not because of the food. The food is good. This 1 star review is for shading business practices. Portillos uses DoorDash for their delivery but beware if you order from them you'll pay significantly higher.   DoorDash doesn't control the prices, The restaurants provide menu and prices and then post what the restaurant wants. This means Portillos purposefully gave them double the prices (large fries is $5 compared to $2.95 and italian beef is $13 compared to $7.70).  There's absolutely NO need to take advantage of DoorDash's or your customers this way. It's a proven fact that when people have convenience from delivery they order way more frequently. This is counter productive as I will NEVER order Portillo's from DoorDash again and if I want it I'll go get it. All that will do is lower my frequency from probably once a month to about 3-4 times a year.   That's if I even order from you again after blatant price gauging. Horrible business practice.  I included a photo so they can't deny it but there you go. 2 regular italian with with peppers, 2 large fries, spaghetti and a meatball. I understand DoorDash does service and delivery fees but your prices are substantially higher than if I went there and you don't have to do shit but prepare the food as normal and they pick it up.  Yes, I understand you pay a percentage of the order from DoorDash but these are incremental orders. Without them, you wouldn't have any orders from them thus no incremental revenue. Such partners help you build incremental revenue and help your bottom line and have larger margins so raising your prices isn't necessary. It's not Ike your rent or utilities go up with more orders, only food expenses. I still can't believe Portillo's would do this. I can see a small mom and pop doing it that doesn't know any better but you? This is very very poor and you just lost a loyal customer and might lose more when people read this. Pictures below are proof.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. I couldn&#39;t add spaghetti but you can clearly see the massive price difference
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Portillo&#39;s hikes up their prices if you order on DoorDash. Don&#39;t do it. Bad business practices.

LPzLjIm9nck4qvO3HVJizQ.text: Recently met another fellow New Yorker and began chatting about good food and the lack of it in Arizona. The conversation came around to Italian Beef, and he recommended Portillo's. While Chicago holds the biggest claim to the sandwich, I've had some damn good experiences back in NY, but no where in between worth speaking of. Well, Portillo's is much better than it has any business being. Not the best I've had, but pretty incredible for a fast food joint that's supposedly known for hot dogs. Maybe they should rename it Portillo's Beef. You have to get both hot and sweet peppers, and ask for it extra dipped.

hUEjPUR1c4QT5PJ643hIyQ.text: Food is good and prices are reasonable. I would normally rate higher because of the quality of the meal and I like hot dogs and beef. However, I also like to have good service, which they lack. Going through the drive through is hectic and staff isn't helpful. I heard a lot of "I don't  know." Inside is busy and loud. Felt the pressure to hurry up and eat so they could make room for more people.

sq4XEp4Gug6IjqOM2VPZyQ.text: My friend and I decided to try this place out on the recommendation of a caterer from Chicago I met while waiting on an oil change here in AZ. Fortunately I had accidentally ended up in their parking lot previously when trying to go to the tempe marketplace. So keep in mind ther lots are not connected, and the entrance off McClintock doesn't really look like an entrance, but is the first curb cut you get to after crossing Rio Salada.  Wer both tried the combo (sausage and shaved beef) on a slightly crusty French bread and with fries. Definitely ask for additional cups of as jus as you'll want it so you can treat it like a French dip. Choice of condiment for the fries was ketchup or ketchup. The trays are awesome, with four paces in the corners to hold drinks steadily while heading to your table.   The place is decorated quite nicely with lots of neon and old signs. It's a comfortable place though slightly loud, even though we were there when it wasn't that busy. I can see at peak time the conflict of the drive through and the parking is likely a headache. And it seems the seats far outnumber the parking, so go in groups if possible.  There is outdoor seating, mostly under cover in a fenced area, but some out of the enclosure so I suppose you could bring a dog along if you wanted.  As long as you go with the right expectations this is a nice place. We'll definitely return.

c5o5M_aSFWKX4WiCDBAxTA.text: Female Manager's face and verbal response when I got out of my car from drive Thru to return 2 beef and cheese croissants. Since the cheese was not melted and the sandwich was cold (Never had issues like this in Chicago) I asked if the could just use the melted cheese. Her response, well we keep the cheese on ice. Disappointing I won't crave anything anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Remade beef and cheese

GRXsbq92EUZB410QN0p0cA.text: The food is great, but they keep messing up my order. I've eaten here five times: twice were dine in, and three times were takeout orders. When I've eaten in, I haven't encountered any issue.  On one takeout occasion, we ordered two beef sandwiches with gravy on the side, a chicken sandwich, and cheese fries. No exaggeration, we waited 25 minutes for the order to be ready. No apologies for the wait, or explanation, was given. When we got home and opened the bags, I was shocked that there were no cups of gravy or cheese sauce. Frustrating. My most recent visit was a repeat of something being forgotten. I ordered two sandwiches, cheese fries, and onion rings. My sandwiches, fries, and all the sauces were there this time. I went to try an onion ring, but I couldn't, because they weren't there.  It's a shame. The beef sandwiches are really good, but how many times can I be burned before I stop going?

sNCsJqhFfG4KXhEEKHCE5A.text: Very well done Chicago style hot dog in the middle of the desert!! Seeing that the restaurant began in Chicago, holds True it even if it is in a fast food fashion.

rdHwflExlK-K6q6-Fp6GdA.text: Eyyyy Chicaaaaago. This is Chicago style goods, eh? Alright! This desert rat is lovin it. Try the tamales. It is NOT a Mexican Tamal. But that's ok, it's what's different that makes it good. Want a greasy burger or dog? They got it, with crinkle cut fries or amazing onion rings. Or try a freshly made salad. Easily a meal with chicken and that house bread.  I still have yet to try the famous Italian Beef, dunked in au jus. One of these times, eh? Tonight I tried the 4 pc chicken strips with chipotle ranch. I suspect the ranch is made in house. I also got a chopped salad. Even brought home takeout on my husband's way home from work, my salad was cool & fresh. Exactly what I was craving.

trQuyFzFgvDhImNYt8Q9aA.text: Looking for a quiet, not too busy place for lunch or dinner? This place isn't for you. Portillo's is always packed, hectic, and loud, but worth it! I've never been to Chicago and haven't frequented the Midwest much but this place reminds me of classic Americana.   I always order an Italian Beef sandwich with extra gravy, which just means that add gravy on the sandwich. You can also get the sandwich dry with gravy on the side, or if you're feeling saucy they'll dunk the whole thing in gravy (a little too soggy for my taste) If you like French Dip with au jus gravy then you'll love this sandwich. Their crinkle fries are great too! A large fry will easily feed 2 people.   Ever wanted to try a blended chocolate cake? Try their chocolate cake shake. It is chocloately-goodness with chunks of cake! But pace yourself or pay with a stomach ache.   During spring training this place is packed with Chicago Cubs fans as the Cubs' stadium is just down the road.   The service is average. Behind the counter, they're very much about speed, which is great! But the employees out in the dining area are friendly and willing to wipe down your table, help you refill your drink, or take your trash.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Italian Beef with Hot Peppers Extra Gravy w/ small fries

FdFf7ITt5l3oMTYPixwLHg.text: You experience will vary here. The restaurant is a all American quick serve establishment, and almost feels like a mall food court with its size and design. I recommend not going during busy times as the wait can be very long with a crowd, and this place can get quite crowded.  That being said it's a fairly inexpensive place to eat, the design of the place can handle the load well, and there is some surprisly good food here, though it depends what you order. I would skip the hot dogs and hamburgers as both are done far better at other nearby places. The hog dogs at a quick trip were better then the ones here, which is strange since this is supposed to be their main pull. Everything else I tried was really good. Portobello mushroom in particular was delicious and not too expensive, as their italian sandwich was tasty.   We had a fairly decent time here and a more accurate rating would be 3 1/2 stars for me.

KQKhvY_dnxZE4QUI4XscGg.text: Just had my bag grown at me thru the drive thru. Worst service ever. She is very angry and needs to find a new job

qKjXaD4sCN65mMMpDkp9oA.text: Stopped in Tempe, had always heard great things about Portillo's and boy were they right! The line was long but, the employees fast working made it go by quick and smooth. I will definitely be back! Just wish there was a location in northern Phoenix. The food was great! Keep up the good work!

2tB6aboIUCrSgQ4fpzBa_w.text: Save yourself the trouble and go inside to order. The drive thru got my order wrong. I ordered a Big beef, dipped with a side of hot peppers. We told them it was wrong at the payment window when they read it back and they said they would correct it. When we got home with our food, I couldn't even eat my sandwich as it was stuffed with hot peppers & dripping with the oil from them. My husband and son had to share a side of gravy & a side of peppers because they only gave us 1 of each. Called to complain and was on hold for more than 10 minutes. Finally gave up and sent an email through their website  2 stars because the food is great when it is made correctly. Just avoid the drive thru.

mkXsHbTCghKV7JkcqFOYxg.text: Honestly I don't see what the hype is all about! can somebody please fill me in.   While Passing by Portillo's I had to make a stop in to see what all the fuss was about.   Me and my husband ordered a hotdog and a beef sandwich!! Unfortunately I don't understand the hype. I feel like it's pretty ordinary hotdog!!  We got the traditional Chicago hot dog with everything on it but unfortunately I don't seem to think that made it a big difference.  The beef sandwich had the potential to be good but it was quite dry, flavorless and bare. The onions and hot peppers did not do enough To add flavor To the bland sandwich.   All in all, im confused and expected more!!

I9c6wFE6V7n5qDl3deE8_g.text: Food is usually always good for me. Never get anything to crazy. Hot dogs, fry's and drinks. But every time no matter if it's inside or drive though I get attitude. No hello, how are you, nothing. Just "what can I get you" next window". Like lord if you hate the job you have so much find another one. I HATE it. Just a smile and some polite words would go a long way.

Bag0kTer_2x64uT8Q6xv9A.text: For real. I got the best spaghetti in a hot dog joint. I like the hot dogs and I got the ribs. The ribs fall off the bone. Seriously, this place was awesome. Was here for a conference and travelled by uber for dinner and it was so worth it. The wait is a little long because of all the people ordering and the seating can be hard. We were there around 9pm and the place was still hopping. If you wanna try a real Chicago dog or just some damn good food, I highly suggest this place.

VlpB9e_OO93GHKsutKhKfA.text: My Italian beef was dry as requested and all the peppers were awesome. This time i had outstanding service (no bs). Go Sunday's cause his rib special is no joke! I was just a little disappointed with the burgers and that they are made in a machine. I'll be back pls blv!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Inside ... tables every where and they have a lot more than just hot dogs and Italian beefs.

KcIZnaaUgq1_dWDgWZzLOQ.text: Fall 2018 update: onion write gs are fantastic!  I'm trying to order online next time.   Who says you can't have a beef and a dog for a late breakfast! They open at 10 and there is no line. This place is different consistent that I eat it every time I'm in Tempe. And sunsets a few times a year every time I go back to Chicago I don't have to go to Portillo's anymore. Sweet!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dipped beef
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. It&#39;s opening up and saying hi! Chicago dogs!

Wealey6tOEhgUWJ4bk7Hyg.text: Lets start off with the cons of this place  Cons: No combo meals  No kid meals  Its literally right up the street from me (this is bad , very bad LOL )  If you can get over that, then I guess you will be ok  I have been a few times now and I have to say they are slowing winning me over. The 1st time I went I swore I would never go back the 2nd time I went I thought damn this is a good hot dog the 3rd time I went I had to admit I am a fan.  I love the Chicago style dog, I always order the Portillos all beef dog, it comes with mustard (big win for me since I'm not a fan of catsup) relish, freshly chopped onions, nice slices of tomato, a quartered dilled pickle and hot peppers all saflely bounded together by a perfectly steamed poppy seed bun and all this for just $2.65!! LOVE IT!   When you check out there menu you will see they have a lot going on, from hot dogs, to sandwiches to burgers, to salads even soup & deserts and for you veggin love fools they even have a meatless menu too, so Im sure there is something for every picky eater out there.  If you haven't given Portillos a try, I think you should, if they didn't win you over the 1st, like me, go back and try it again, believe me it wasn't love at 1st bite for me either but now I'm a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States

okBQ_AXXs5qXK0id9ScLwA.text: Go out of your way to eat here no matter what the wait is. If your going at lunch or dinner time expect a line. They will get you your food quick and it will be worth the wait. Everything, and I mean everything here is good. I've been through their entire menus and you can't go wrong!

SEDnZXuatF2TUq5K2gPuAQ.text: It was so loud in the restaurant the cashier had a hard time hearing my order. I had a hard time hearing what she said and had to repeat my self. The cashier was rude. Place was may be 1/3 full. The guy calling out numbers had a hard time location my order and it was hard to hear what numbers he was calling out. Had the beef hot dog. Ive been to Chicago and it vaguely resembled the dog I had IN Chicago. The best part of my meal was the onion rings, diet coke and leaving!

DlIfXWRhAnvXEU_e7ZePlg.text: I cannot comment of anything else but the Italian Beef, my LORD is it fantastic!! I should try other menu items but I just can't bring myself to do it, I can't comprehend how anything could be better than the Italian Beef. There's really nothing left to say, it's awesome!

25qTir1GtWEfaJp7oyuP8A.text: Waited THIRTY, yeah, 30 minutes for my food. My friend ordered at the same time, got his food, ate it, ordered something else, got that, and also ate that, all before I got my food. I spoke to 3 employees none of which gave me a clear answer. Finally I was fed up and spoke to a manager who simply just gave me a refund. No food, no drink, nothing. So I got back in line and ordered the exact same thing and paid for it. Waited again for that food and never got it. Got another refund and still no food and no drink. Awful awful awful experience.

iCjxgwle1WRLAYLV2Nztbg.text: Ever since visiting Chicago, I've had dreams of a delicious Chicago style dog with sport peppers (which is the most important component). I randomly stumbled upon this place and was pleasantly surprised to find the key to satisfying my inner Chicago needs.   At the end of the day, it was a pretty basic and generic dog. Sometimes people just don't understand how much further along a grilled dog would get a guy versus just a boiled one. But what bumped this up from a 3 to 4 star for me was the environment. It's a really cool place and I'm excited to try something different next time.

YSksLlLZT2QE_Xp8WY8rhQ.text: My favorite to go place.... the beef sandwich are my favorite followed by the Chicago style hotdogs.  I've had the bbq ribs and those were tender.

vzZnd-5P-1rJqJECBQNieQ.text: What's not to love about portillos? Their beefs are always hot and delicious. No matter how obscenely long the lines seem they move really quickly. The chocolate cake is perfect and moist and you can't go wrong with a hot dog. Gotta love cheese fries too.

gd09aZTOBBtyGiD6Pg07Aw.text: Being from Chicago, it's pretty obvious how I feel about Portillos.... their food is delicious!! It hits the spot every time! Their hotdogs are amazing and pair perfectly with fries and the onion rings. The service is also very good. I've never encountered an issue. But they're always very friendly. The only thing I noticed today, was that by the time I went to eat my hot dog, the bun was a little soggy, like it had been sitting for a bit. But still very tasty! I love coming here. Don't forget to add a shake or malt!! You'll thank me :)

1EI-tqAKPpM4AYODitQUfw.text: 1st time dining in w/ my husband & two girls (3 & 11 months)  Yum, the Italian Beef Sandwich is great! I ordered mine how most on here recommended; With Sweet & Spicy Peppers. I didn't get mine w/ extra gravy but still yummy..  Not really a kid friendly place (no kid menu, or child specific anything) which was a bit of a disappointment since most things on menu are large portioned.  Only negative experience of my trip was when I attempted to purchase a dessert. I return to the counter to order a Strawberry Short Cake (to bring home) but the cashier insisted, pursued, bribed and continued on selling me a chocolate Cake Shake...which was annoying after I explained 2-3 times that I didn't want to order that. Which he then said he had a competition going with another staff? I don't know, but I ended up leaving without buying any dessert just so I could get away from the cashier!  I wish he would've just let me breathe & purchased what I wanted :(   Otherwise, everything else was super yummy. I'll just use the drive thru next visit, lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Italian Beef with Sweet and Spicy Peppers

tVA6_dl8ph8kRLP7Q1BgTg.text: Have eaten here several times.  Ordered the burger bun was so soggy from the grease.  I spoke with manger completely unapologetic.  He said he would have another one made.  He brought one out there was grease down the side of the bag.  Upon opening the burger container grease dropped out.  I picked up the burger and it was literally dripping grease into the container.  A pool of grease in the bottom.  The manager didn't even check it prior to giving to me.  He didn't follow up until he saw me taking pictures of it.  Then came and ask if it was better.  See pictures and the pool of grease.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States

w78ruqIj2YKMUls67dn22g.text: As I left Cubs spring training, there in the distance, a vision of beautiful splendor appeared like a mirage in the desert heat. The restaurant I'd loved in Chicago had followed my team to Arizona.   Like Joliet Jake seeing the light, I proclaimed "The Italian beef!" and subsequently sent my rental car into a Blues Mobile like Mission From God.  Extra gravy, hot peppers, & a hot dog  (the only way they serve it is Chicago Style) made my day.   It's no 4 fried chickens and a Coke. It's better. It's heaven on a bun. It's what world peace would taste like.   A chocolate cake shake completed my feast of all things right in the world & restored my faith in humanity.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States

zgkeHO4EXe7HWgYT4eoxFw.text: I've heard of this place several times because of the Kinda Funny Podcast and how it's main guy always hypes the place up. Driving through this area my friend and I decided to try it out. I was blown away by how large the inside was since it didn't look to big from the outside. The staff was very friendly and the place was clean. I ordered a Portillo Hot Dog with everything, onion rings and a strawberry shake. We waited maybe 8 minutes tops (it was very busy) and got out food. It was absolutely delicious! The hot dogs were Chicago Style and had the works in it: hot peppers, pickles, sweet relish, tomatoes...so damn good! The onion rings were solid and were especially good with ranch dipping sauce. The shake was also great. It just worked together so well creating a great overall experience. I wanted to eat another hot dog as soon as I left the place that's how good it was! Overall, definitely would come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Place was packed but the lines moved quick.
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. The bag is just adorable :)
Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Portillo Hot Dog was absolutely fantastic

2-k9Kpxq5X1plbjoRXy3Cw.text: Portillo's hails from Chicago. They're doing a land office business in Scottsdale and Tempe.  My Italian Beef was SUPERB. Portillo's is clean and well organized, featuring efficient service to handle the BIG crowds.  Stop-in prior to, or after a Cubs game...you won't be disappoiinted.

FYYzMb3ZnFgOvQUOr6Wchg.text: We used to LOVE coming here. Haven't been in awhile, and today I thought I would stop by and grab a couple of Garbage Salads. I'm so disappointed! These salads used to be LOADED with meats and cheeses, and came with a delicious poppy seed muffin. Imagine my surprise when I opened up my salad to discover barely any meat or cheese, and instead of a poppy seed muffin now it's a dried out roll. Not cool, Portillo's, not cool.

3La00xInpxtqSgA1nDOEBw.text: Excellent Chicago food.  You don't need to be a Chicago Cubs' fan to enjoy this great food.  Big Beef and Beef and Sausage are crazy good.

kFfG4i7DPZiAkwXQlE5j0g.text: I visited this restaurant for the first time a few days ago. Wow!!! It's a retro 1950's Chicago-themed fast food restaurant specializing in hot dogs, sausages and burgers. They also have an extensive salad menu. They play 1950's music and the decor matches. This is a fun place to take children to or a fun family outing.  I thought the food was spectacular! I also tried the, "Pumpkin shake" which was out-of-this-world!  I hereby confer a solid 5 star rating!

KS_U3h8BI0_Iv7wamzxDAQ.text: I came here and got ribs , was horrible & fake !! I rather have a McRib sandwich!  I get better service and McDonald's. That's is the True ! I been here many times and I can't believe this service and the food ! It's like nobody wants to work today geeesh!

q8opDTrDTEcNnHcHS957VQ.text: Great food but good luck getting your order right.  I ordered a meatball sandwich, which took over 20 minutes to make at the drive thru.  When I get home, I see they gave me one meatball in a cup.  Who TF orders that?!  I'm hungry.  Thanks a lot for the waste of time.  Oh BTW you don't get your receipt till they give you your food, so you can't tell if your order's wrong.  I had no idea they served meatballs in a cup... Weird.  When you hear them saying one meatball you assume they mean one meatball sandwich and not one in a cup.  Oh and my man's burger was luke warm because some douche made it before the single meatball in a cup...with no cheese on it either!  Oh and the chick taking the order got testy with me when I asked for onion on the burger and said it already comes with that...but the menu doesn't say that.. it says it comes with lettuce, tomatoes, Mayo, pickles and ketchup.

gKOUsYAml4couJXSQmtOBg.text: First time eating here and I am not impressed. My son order a hamburger and the bread was soggy the meat had no taste, my husband order one too and he said the same. I order the croissant chicken no taste. I liked the fries and the tamales. The staff was confused and un friendly it was a Sunday night and there was slot if people but they should be use to a big crowd.

O1n-DsJO7jd9pICnrMJUbA.text: This place never disappoints. I don't go here often but it always puts a smile on my face when I get sloppy with the Big Beef Sandwich with both hot and sweet peppers and side of Gravy.  If the Beef and Cheddar Croissant could hold more beef and not fall apart when it gets dipped then I would definitely say its the perfect sandwich.  Being a man who respects Chicago Style beef and sandwiches, this place is probably the best Phoenix has to offer.   I recommend it to anyone who is looking for a hearty meal with great Chicago style food.

ITR0D2h4fi1YAgDv8GjlnQ.text: I would give this place 3.5 stars if I could as I have no real complaints. This was my first time and I tried the full pallet of what they are known for; dipped Italian beef sandwich, Chicago dog, onion rings and chocolate cake. The beef sandwich was good, hot dog was good, onion rings were crispy and good and chocolate cake was great for a fast food joint. But nothing was spectacular. Good place not incredible.

hM8IBYe3GF-p0lx4FF3RQw.text: Being from Chicago I absolutely love being able to get a taste of home every once in awhile since phoenix isn't exactly known for its food.

photos.caption: Photo of Portillo's Hot Dogs - Tempe, AZ, United States. Me and the family at portillos

XSjwDSpgSLMUuRt-xKsNYQ.text: Deliciousness!! That's what I say after each visit to Portillo's!  This is a legendary Chicago restaurant...entering this restaurant brings me right back home.  Hands down the best beef sandwich in the valley!  Make sure to get it dipped for an extra soggy bun.   The fries are crispy with the perfect amount of salt.   Top it off with a Chocolate Shake and you have yourself a meal!  The hot dogs are authentic And actually have a poppy seed bun....a rare find in AZ!    I love this place and will continue to come back again and again.  You can take the girl out of Chicago, but you can't take Chicago out of the girl.  Thanks for Portillo's for giving me a little piece of home right here in AZ!

m8UzZlLQzBOJcrLbiEnOgQ.text: Great place if you like Chicago style food, i lived just south of chicago for over 30 years and now live in phoenix.  i love going to this place. the chicago style hot dogs are amazing. everything there is great.
